data.title: 89 Notable Alumni of Moldova State University [Sorted List]
data.meta_description: Below is the list of 89 notable alumni from Moldova State University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.
data.meta_site_name: EduRank.org - Discover university rankings by location
data.text:
89 Notable alumni of

Moldova State University

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

Moldova State University is 990th in the world, 344th in Europe, and 1st in Moldova by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 89 notable alumni from Moldova State University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Galina Brezhneva

Born in

Russia

Years

1929-1998 (aged 69)

Biography

Galina Leonidovna Brezhneva was the daughter of Soviet politician and longtime General Secretary Leonid Brezhnev and Viktoria Brezhneva.

Natalia Gavrilița

Born in

Moldova

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Occupations

politicianjuristeconomist

Biography

Natalia Gavrilița is a Moldovan economist and politician who served as prime minister of Moldova from 2021 until her resignation in February 2023 after failure to get her reform package enacted.

Nicolae Nasoc

Born in

Moldova

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

statespersonjuristpoliticianjudge

Biography

Nicolae Timofti is a Moldovan jurist and politician who was President of Moldova from 23 March 2012 until 23 December 2016. He served as head of Moldova's Superior Magistrate Council and was elected President by parliament on 16 March 2012.

Petru Lucinschi

Born in

Moldova

Years

1940-.. (age 84)

Occupations

diplomathistorianpoliticianphilosopherstatesperson

Biography

Petru Lucinschi is a former Moldovan politician who was Moldova's second President from 1997 to 2001. He currently serves as the founder and head of the Lucinschi Foundation of Strategic Studies and International Relations.

Zinaida Greceanîi

Born in

Russia

Years

1956-.. (age 68)

Occupations

economistpolitician

Biography

Zinaida Greceanîi is a Moldovan politician. She was the President of the Moldovan Parliament between 8 June 2019 to 26 July 2021. Greceanîi was previously also the Prime Minister of Moldova from 31 March 2008 to 14 September 2009. She led the Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova (PSRM) from 2016 to 2020 and was previously a member of the Party of Communists of the Republic of Moldova (PCRM). She was Moldova's first female Prime Minister and was the second female Communist head of government in Europe, preceded only by Premier Milka Planinc of former Yugoslavia. She has been referred to by her colleagues in PSRM as the "Moldovan Margaret Thatcher".

Marian Lupu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1966-.. (age 58)

Occupations

economistpolitician

Biography

Marian Lupu is a Moldovan economist and politician who was the President of the Parliament of Moldova between 2010 and 2013. From this position he served as Acting President of Moldova from 2010 until 2012.

Mihai Ghimpu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Mihai Ghimpu is a Moldovan politician who served as President of the Moldovan Parliament and Acting President of Moldova from 2009 to 2010. He was member of Parliament of Moldova from 1990 to 1998 and from 2009 to 2019. Ghimpu held the position of leader of Liberal Party (PL) from 1998 to 2018.

Natalia Gherman

Born in

Moldova

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Enrolled in Moldova State University

Studied in 1991

Occupations

diplomatpoliticianphilologist

Biography

Natalia Gherman is a Moldovan politician who has been serving as executive director of the United Nations' Counter-Terrorism Executive Directorate since 2023.

Nicolae Dabija

Born in

Moldova

Years

1948-2021 (aged 73)

Enrolled in Moldova State University

Studied in 1972

Occupations

poetliterary historianwriterpolitician

Biography

Nicolae Dabija was a writer, literary historian, and politician from the Republic of Moldova, honorary member of the Romanian Academy (from 2003) and corresponding member of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova (from 2012).

Alexander Gelman

Born in

Moldova

Years

1933-.. (age 91)

Occupations

prose writerwriteropinion journalistjournalistplaywright

Biography

Alexander Isaakovich Gelman, original given name Shunya (Russian: Шу́ня), is a Bessarabian-born Soviet and Russian playwright, writer, and screenwriter.

Aureliu Ciocoi

Born in

Moldova

Years

1968-.. (age 56)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Aureliu Ciocoi is a Moldovan diplomat and politician who served as Acting Prime Minister of Moldova from December 2020 to August 2021. He is currently the country's ambassador to Germany and Denmark. Prior positions that Ciocoi held include being the country's Minister of Foreign Affairs and former ambassador to the United States, China and Vietnam.

Ion Sturza

Born in

Moldova

Years

1960-.. (age 64)

Occupations

politicianentrepreneureconomist

Biography

Ion Sturza is a Moldovan politician and businessman who served as Prime Minister of Moldova from 19 February to 12 November 1999. On 21 December 2015, President Nicolae Timofti nominated Ion Sturza to occupy the position of prime minister for a second time. However, Ion Sturza gave up the mandate, after the meeting in which his cabinet should receive the investiture vote was not held due to lack of quorum.

Nata Albot

Born in

Moldova

Years

1979-.. (age 45)

Occupations

journalist

Biography

Nata Albot is a blogger, TV producer, journalist and a media manager from Moldova. She has had several popular shows on radio and televisions in Moldova since she was 16 years old. She graduated from the Law School of Moldova State University. Nata Albot served as the general producer of Jurnal TV from March 2010 until July 2013. She also worked as the director of Radio Pro FM Chișinău, reporter for Pro TV, Director of TV reality talent show "Star Academy" at Prime TV. Also, as a freelancer, has produced the TV series "Aventura Americană" about Moldovan students summers spent with work and travel in the United States.

Valeriu Streleț

Born in

Moldova

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Enrolled in Moldova State University

Studied in 1987-1993

Occupations

economistpolitician

Biography

Valeriu Streleț is a Moldovan politician who was Prime Minister of Moldova in 2015. He subsequently received a vote of no-confidence on 29 October 2015.

Mircea Druc

Born in

Moldova

Years

1941-.. (age 83)

Occupations

university teachereconomistpoliticiantranslatortractor driver

Biography

Mircea Druc is a Moldovan and Romanian politician who served as Prime Minister of Moldova between 26 May 1990 and 22 May 1991.

Mihai Balan

Born in

Moldova

Years

1960-.. (age 64)

Occupations

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Mihai Balan is a Moldovan diplomat. He was the ambassador of the Republic of Moldova to Israel in January–October 2012, and prior to this was ambassador of Moldova to Greece and Cyprus (2010 – 2011). Bălan was the Foreign Policy Advisor to the President of Moldova (December 15, 2009 - August 2010).

Leonida Lari

Born in

Moldova

Years

1949-2011 (aged 62)

Occupations

writerpoliticianpoettranslatorjournalist

Biography

Leonida Lari was a Moldovan poet, journalist, and politician who advocated for the reunion of Bessarabia with Romania. She published 24 volumes of poetry and prose and was a prolific translator of key works from world literature into Romanian.

Tatiana Țîbuleac

Born in

Moldova

Years

1978-.. (age 46)

Occupations

journalisttranslatorwriter

Biography

Tatiana Tibuleac is a Moldovan writer. She was born in Chisinau and studied journalism and communications at Moldova State University. She first gained renown for her "True Stories" column which appeared in the Flux newspaper in the mid-1990s. She also worked as a TV reporter and news anchor in Chisinau. She moved to Paris in 2008.

Mihai Grecu

Born in

Ukraine

Years

1916-1998 (aged 82)

Occupations

paintervisual artist

Biography

Mihai Grecu was a painter from Moldova. According to Lonely Planet,

Iurie Roșca

Born in

Moldova

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Occupations

statespersonjournalistpolitician

Biography

Iurie Roșca is a Moldovan politician who has served as president of the Christian-Democratic People's Party (PPCD) since 1994.

Igor Vieru

Born in

Moldova

Years

1923-1988 (aged 65)

Occupations

painterillustrator

Biography

Igor Vieru was a painter from Moldova. The artist's home, in Cernoleuca has become a museum, where visitors can get acquainted with Igor Vieru's art. High School of Fine Arts "Igor Vieru" in Chişinău was named after him.

Oleg Serebrian

Born in

Moldova

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Occupations

geopolitical analystpoliticianpolitical scientistdiplomat

Biography

Oleg Serebrian is a Moldovan politician, writer, diplomat and political scientist, President of the Latin Union between 2010 and 2012.

Gheorghe Duca

Born in

Moldova

Years

1952-.. (age 72)

Occupations

chemistpolitician

Biography

Gheorghe Duca is a Moldovan academic and politician who is a former president of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, an honorary member of the Romanian Academy, and former Moldovan Minister of Environment, Public Works and Regional Development.

Ion Vatamanu

Born in

Ukraine

Years

1937-1993 (aged 56)

Occupations

researcherwriterpoliticianchemist

Biography

Ion Vatamanu was a chemist, writer, and politician from Moldova. He served as member of the Parliament of Moldova (1990–1994) and chairman of the Committee on Culture of the Parliament of Moldova.

Mark Tkaciuk

Born in

Moldova

Years

1966-.. (age 58)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Mark Tkachuk is a Moldovan politician, historian, archaeologist and anthropologist, former member of the Parliament of the Republic of Moldova.

Israel Gohberg

Born in

Ukraine

Years

1928-2009 (aged 81)

Enrolled in Moldova State University

Studied in 1947-1951

Occupations

university teachermathematician

Biography

Israel Gohberg was a Bessarabian-born Soviet and Israeli mathematician, most known for his work in operator theory and functional analysis, in particular linear operators and integral equations.

Boris Kolker

Born in

Moldova

Years

1939-.. (age 85)

Occupations

writerteacheresperantologisttranslatorEsperantist

Biography

Boris Grigorevich Kolker is a language teacher, translator and advocate of the international language Esperanto. He was until 1993 a Soviet and Russian citizen and since then has been a resident and citizen of the United States residing in Cleveland, Ohio. In 1985 he was awarded a Ph.D. in linguistics from the Institute of Linguistics of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR in Moscow.

Andrei Spînu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1986-.. (age 38)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Andrei Spinu is a Moldovan entrepreneur and politician, who was Deputy Prime Minister of Moldova in the Government of Gavrilița and currently serves as Minister of Infrastructure and Regional Development in the Recean Cabinet.

Alexandru Stoianoglo

Born in

Moldova

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Alexandr Stoianoglo is a Moldovan politician.

Todur Zanet

Born in

Moldova

Years

1958-.. (age 66)

Occupations

opinion journalistplaywrightprose writerpoliticiantranslator

Biography

Todur Zanet is a Gagauz and Moldovan journalist, folklorist and poet, one of the most prominent contributors to Gagauz literature and theater. He is the editor-in-chef of Ana Sözü newspaper, which cultivates the Gagauz language, and has written the original anthem of Gagauzia. His activity as a journalist began under Soviet rule, and first peaked during the Perestroika years, when he became involved with the Gagauz nationalist movement.

Silvia Radu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1972-.. (age 52)

Occupations

juristmanagerpoliticianphilologist

Biography

Silvia Radu is a Moldovan politician and manager. Between 2008 and 2015 she was the director of Gas Natural Fenosa in the Republic of Moldova. In 2016, she was an independent candidate in that year's presidential election. From 6 November 2017 until April, 2018 Radu served as the ad interim of Mayor of Chișinău.

Monica Babuc

Born in

Moldova

Years

1964-.. (age 60)

Occupations

politicianhistorian

Biography

Monica Babuc is a politician and historian from the Republic of Moldova, who was Minister of Culture of the Republic of Moldova in four consecutive cabinets (Leancă, Gaburici, Streleţ and Filip) from 2013 to 2019.

Mihai Cimpoi

Born in

Moldova

Years

1942-.. (age 82)

Occupations

editing staffliterary criticpoliticianliterary historianphilosopher

Biography

Mihai Cimpoi is a Moldovan politician, a distinguished cultural scientist, Romanian academician, critic and literary historian, eminescologist, literary editor and Bessarabian essayist. "Emeritus of the Republic of Moldova", two decades elected president of the Union of Writers of Moldova, deputy in the Parliament of the Republic of Moldova between 1999 and 2001, Mihai Cimpoi is the author of some fundamental works such as: "An Open History of the Romanian literature in Bessarabia" (in several editions) and "Mihai Eminescu. Encyclopedic Dictionary" - a unique monumental work. Mihai Cimpoi is the author and developer of the long-term project "The World Congress of Eminescologists", launched in 2012 and became a tradition.

Rodica Ciorănică

Born in

Moldova

Years

1976-.. (age 48)

Occupations

journalist

Biography

Rodica Ciorănică-Gavriliţă is a journalist and editor from Moldova. She founded VIP Magazin in 2004. Since 2007, she has had a TV show on Pro TV Chişinău and then on Prime TV. Rodica Ciorănică is the head of VIP Magazin Grup. Besides VIP Magazin, she edits two other magazines, 50 cei mai influenti Moldoveni (The 50 most influential Moldavians) and 99 femei din Moldova (99 women from Moldova). She is married to Sergiu Gavriliţă (their marriage godfather being Sergiu Mocanu) and they have a daughter.

Moldova

Years

Alexandru Moșanu was a Moldovan politician, historian and professor.

Studied in 1997-2001

Occupations

jurist

Biography

Viorica Dumbrăveanu is a Moldovan politician. She served as Minister of Health, Labour and Social Protection from 14 November 2019 to 31 December 2020 in the cabinet of Prime Minister Ion Chicu.

Valeriu Pasat

Born in

Moldova

Years

1958-.. (age 66)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Valeriu Pasat is a Moldovan historian and politician. He held the office of Minister of Defense of Moldova in the Ciubuc and Sturza cabinets.

Alexandru Oleinic

Born in

Moldova

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

politicianengineereconomist

Biography

Alexandru Oleinic is a Moldovan politician, who was elected as a deputy in the Parliament of the Republic of Moldova in two consecutive legislatures between 2001 and 2009, on the lists of the Electoral Bloc Democratic Moldova. Between 2009 and 2011 he was Minister of Information Technologies and Communications of the Republic of Moldova in the First Vlad Filat Cabinet.

Ana Guțu

Moldova

1962-.. (age 62)

Studied in 1984

1985-1990 graduated with doctorate

Ana Guțu is a Moldovan politician, who served as Member of the Parliament of Moldova from 2009 to 2014.

Sergiu Sîrbu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1980-.. (age 44)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Sergiu Sîrbu is a Moldovan politician and jurist, who started serving in 2010 as Deputy in the Parliament of Moldova as member of the faction of Democratic Party of Moldova. On 11 July 2014, Sîrbu became Deputy President of the Parliament of Moldova. Sergiu Sîrbu was member of Party of Communists of the Republic of Moldova until 12 December 2012, when he left the party. The same year, Sîrbu is member of Democratic Party of Moldova.

Iurie Muntean

Moldova

Years

1972-.. (age 52)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Iurie Muntean is a Moldovan politician, who served as a deputy Minister of Economy and Trade (2008–2009) and member of the Parliament of Moldova (2009–2014).

Igor Corman

Born in

Moldova

Years

1969-.. (age 55)

Occupations

diplomathistorianpolitician

Biography

Igor Corman is a Moldovan politician and diplomat, President of the Moldovan Parliament from 30 May 2013 until 29 December 2014.

Moldova

1971-.. (age 53)

Enrolled in Moldova State University

Studied in 1989-1994

Studied in 1997-1999

Liliana Palihovici is a Moldovan politician.

Moldova

1959-.. (age 65)

Biography

Valeriu Matei is a Moldovan writer and politician. He served as a member of the Parliament of Moldova from 1990. Matei is a member of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova and an honorific member of the Romanian Academy since 2011. He ran in the 1996 Moldovan presidential election.

Veaceslav Untilă

Veaceslav Untilă is a Moldovan politician.

Biography

Viorel Cibotaru is a Moldovan politician, former political analyst and journalist, who served as the Minister of Defense of Moldova between 18 February 2015 and 30 July 2015. Since 18 June 2016 Cibotaru is chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova. Cibotaru has authored four books.

Stepan Beril

Born in

Russia

Years

1951-.. (age 73)

Occupations

university teacherphysicist

Biography

Stepan Beril is the president of T. G. Shevchenko University in Tiraspol, the capital of the partially recognised state of Transnistria. He has presided over the university with 14 faculties and 84 chairs, offering 54 different majors, since 1996.

Anatol Țăranu

Moldova

1951-.. (age 73)

Biography

Anatol Țăranu is a Moldovan politician.

1926-1998 (aged 72)

Biography

Sergiu Rădăuțanu was a Moldovan physicist. He was a member of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova and professor at the State Technical University in Chișinău.

Born in

Moldova

Years

1934-2007 (aged 73)

film directorwriterscreenwriter

Biography

Gheorghe Vodă was a writer, screenwriter and film director from Moldova.

Nicolae Andronic

Born in

Moldova

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Nicolae Andronic is a Moldovan jurist and lawyer. He served as member of Parliament of Moldova between 1990 and 1998 and as Deputy Speaker of the Parliament of Moldova in 1994. He headed the extra-parliamentary Republican Popular Party from 2005 to 2015.

Oleg Țulea

Born in

Moldova

Years

1980-.. (age 44)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Oleg Ţulea is a Moldovan politician who served as the foreign minister of the Republic of Moldova in 2020. He previously served as member of the Parliament of Moldova (2005–2009). 1998, Oleg Tsulya joined the Democratic Party of Moldova (PDM) and was elected chairman of the DPM youth organization "Democratic Youth". On 3 February 2016, he was appointed as the Ambassador to Hungary. On 29 June 2016, he was appointed concurrently as ambassador to Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Slovenia. He was also the deputy sports minister from 2009 to 2011. He is fluent in Romanian, Russian and English, and speaks French at an intermediate level.

Vitalia Pavlicenco

Born in

Moldova

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

philologistpolitician

Biography

Vitalia Pavlicenco is a Moldovan politician. She was the head of the National Liberal Party (Moldova).

Andrei Eșanu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1948-.. (age 76)

Occupations

politicianhistorian

Biography

Andrei Eșanu is a historian (doctor habilitat in history), writer and researcher from the Republic of Moldova. He is a member of the Commission for the Study of the Communist Dictatorship in Moldova. He is part of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, and was elected an honorary member of the Romanian Academy in 2011.

Isaac Bersuker

Born in

Moldova

Years

1928-.. (age 96)

Occupations

chemistphysicist

Biography

Isaac B. Bersuker is a Soviet-Moldоvan-American theoretical physicist and quantum chemist whose principal research is in chemical physics, solid-state physics, and theoretical chemistry. Known for his "life-long years of experience in theoretical chemistry" working on the electronic structure and properties of coordination compounds, Isaac B. Bersuker is “one of the most widely recognized authorities” in the theory of the Jahn–Teller effect (JTE) and the pseudo-Jahn–Teller effect (PJTE). His accomplishments include explaining the polarization of the atomic core in Rydberg atoms, the effect of tunneling splitting in molecules and solids with a strong JTE, and the discovery of the PJTE origin of ferroelectricity in cubic perovskites. Known as the leading expert in JTE and PJTE, Bersuker is the permanent chairman of the international steering committee of the Jahn–Teller symposia. His present affiliation is with the Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Science of the Department of Chemistry of the University of Texas at Austin.

Yulia Sister

Born in

Moldova

Years

1936-.. (age 88)

Occupations

chemist

Biography

Yulia Sister is a Soviet Moldavian and Israeli analytical chemist engaged in chemical research with the use of polarography and chromatography, a science historian, and a researcher of Russian Jewry in Israel, France, and other countries. She holds the position of Director General of the Research Centre for Russian Jews abroad and in Israel.

Anatol Codru

Born in

Moldova

Years

1936-2010 (aged 74)

Occupations

film directortranslatorpoet

Biography

Anatol Codru was a writer and film director from Moldova. He was the head of the Union of Cinematographers of Moldova and a leader of the Democratic Forum of Romanians in Moldova.

Constantin Cheianu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1959-.. (age 65)

Occupations

actorjournalist

Biography

Constantin Cheianu is a writer, playwright, prose writer, publicist, actor and TV anchor and journalist from the Republic of Moldova. As a dramaturg at the National Theatre in Chişinău, he adapted multiple novels for the stage. In 1993, together with the movie director Alexandru Vasilache he became co-founder of the Pocket Theatre (Romanian: Teatrul de Buzunar). Together with Anatol Durbala he leads the show Ora de Ras at Jurnal TV.

politician

Zurab Todua is a Moldovan historian, politician, politologue, publicist and writer, who served as deputy in the Parliament of Moldova between 2010 and 2014.

Domnica Manole is a Moldovan judge. She has served as the President of the Constitutional Court of Moldova since April 2020.

Moldova

1984-.. (age 40)

politician

Biography

Ion Cebanu is a Moldovan politician. He was Minister of Youth and Sports between 25 September 2009 and 26 February 2013 in the First Vlad Filat Cabinet and in the Second Filat Cabinet as well, President of the Liberal Party Territorial Organization, Centru branch of Chisinau, member of the Central Permanent Bureau of the Liberal Party, president of the Public Association "Optimus".

Nicolae Bulat was a Moldovan historian and director of Soroca Museum of History and Ethnography (including Soroca Fortress).

Octavian Calmîc is a former Moldovan politician. He served as Minister of Economy and Infrastructure from 20 January 2016 to 21 December 2017.

politician

Biography

Oleg Efrim is a Moldovan politician and jurist. He has served as the Justice Minister in Second Vlad Filat Cabinet since 6 May 2011 until 18 February 2015. He is a member of the Liberal Democratic Party of Moldova.

Ion Țurcanu

Born in

Moldova

Years

1946-.. (age 78)

Biography

Ion Țurcanu is an author, educator, historian, memoirist, professor, former member of the Parliament (1990–1994), politician and Romanian writer from Moldova. He is one of the 277 MPs of the first parliament of the former Soviet Socialist Republic (later the Republic of Moldova), who voted for the Declaration of Independence of the Republic of Moldova on 27 August 1991.

Alina Zotea-Durnea is a Moldovan economist, model and politician.

Victor Bodiu is a Moldovan economist. In 2001 he began working with Raiffeisen Banking Group.

Leonid Bujor was a Moldovan politician. He was the Minister of Education in the First Vlad Filat Cabinet from 25 September 2009 to 14 January 2011.

Valeriu Pleşca is a Moldovan lawyer and politician. He served as Minister of Defense of Moldova between 29 December 2004 and 11 June 2007.

Ernest Arushanov is a Soviet and Moldovan experimental physicist, academician of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova.

Biography

Victor Osipov is a Moldovan politician who since 18 February 2015 has served as Deputy Prime Minister for Reintegration of the Republic of Moldova, being the second time in this post after the 2009–2011 mandate in the Filat Government. He was the Deputy Prime Minister in charge of Moldova's territorial re-integration in the First Vlad Filat Cabinet.

Moldova

Eugen Carpov is a diplomat and politician from Moldova. He was the Deputy Prime Minister for Reintegration of the Republic of Moldova from 14 January 2011 to 10 December 2014 (Second Vlad Filat Cabinet).

Moldova

Years

1957-.. (age 67)

politiciandiplomat

Biography

Iuliana Gorea-Costin is a diplomat and politician from the Republic of Moldova. She is a philologist and lawyer by education and served as the first Permanent Representative of Moldova to the Council of Europe and the first director of the "Mircea Eliade" Romanian-English High School in Chişinău. She ran as an independent candidate in Moldovan presidential election, 1996. and Chișinău election, 2005.

Biography

Larisa Miculeț is a lawyer and Moldovan government official, currently holding the position of the Chargé d’Affairs of the Embassy of the Republic of Moldova to Ireland. Previously, Mrs. Miculeț held the position of Ambassador at Large at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration being in charge of Multilateral diplomacy, and concurrently serving as the Head of National delegation to IHRA (International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance).

Biography

Serafim Saca was a writer from Moldova. He is credited with being the author and director of several documentaries including House with Flowers (1965), Chișinău – 67 (1967), and Cross-Roads (1967). He became a member of the Moldovan Writers' Union in 1966. He was forbidden to publish between 1976 and 1987.

Biography

Anatol Ciobanu was a Moldovan professor and researcher. He was head of the Department of Romanian language at Moldova State University, a corresponding member of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova, and a leader of the Democratic Forum of Romanians in Moldova.

Biography

Anatol Arapu is a Moldovan economist, who served as Minister of Finances of Moldova from 14 August 2013 to January 2016, in three consecutive cabinets: Leancă Cabinet, Gaburici Cabinet, and Streleț Cabinet. He also was Minister of Finances in the 1990s, in Ciubuc-2 Cabinet (22 May 1998 - 17 February 1999) and in Sturza Cabinet (12 March - 12 November 1999).

Biography

Gheorghe Malarciuc was a screenwriter and politician from Moldova. He served as the first head of the Ecologist Party of Moldova "Green Alliance". He graduated in 1956 from Moldova State University and worked for Moldova-Film and Literaturnaya Gazeta.
